Articles.Content:
Why don't we start a book and website resource thread? I want to learn more and having some great resources for all things space and rocketry would be awesome! Maybe even organizing each book or site into categories like rockets, people, planets, etc. Let's get some good suggestions!

Some Sites:

Encyclopedia on all things exploration: http://www.astronautix.com/index.html

NASA Rocket Index: http://exploration.grc.nasa.gov/education/rocket/shortr.html

Orbital Mechanics: http://www.braeunig.us/space/orbmech.htm#conic

Atomic Rocketry: http://www.projectrho.com/public_html/rocket/

Some Books:

Xenology: http://www.xenology.info/Xeno.htm

Edited June 22, 2013 by Rocketeer Hopeful

Xenology (http://www.xenology.info/Xeno.htm) is the book about extraterrestrial life.

Atomic Rockets (http://www.projectrho.com/public_html/rocket/index.php) is the website about designing rockets.
